newsitem.title: UK: Cairn hits peak on bid talk, firm oil market.
newsitem.headline: Cairn hits peak on bid talk, firm oil market.

text.p: Shares in Cairn Energy jumped by almost five percent to a new record peak amid growing bid speculation, dealers said.
By 1325 GMT, the shares were up 24p to 509-1/2p, off their all-time best levels of 517 set earlier.
"Everyone is out there looking for the next bid stock and there's a bit of bid froth in Cairn," said one market maker.

Firm oil prices, plus news that a Cairn subsidiary and Halliburton unit had signed a gas purchase and sale agreement with the Bangladesh Oil, Gas and Mineral Corp, also helped lift the shares, dealers said. "The deal helps market sentiment, but it's mainly the bid talk and oil prices," the market maker said.
Brent crude for February delivery was up nine cents to $24.43 per barrel on the International Petroleum Exchange.

Others in the sector also gained. Among them, Lasmo jumped 7-1/2p to 251, one penny off the record high set earlier. Enterprise Oil, which was Britain's best performing blue chip stock in 1996, added 5-1/2p to 633.
